articles.title: Nvidia’s GeForce Now is getting native Linux and Fire TV apps - The Verge
articles.description: Nvidia is launching new GeForce Now apps for Linux and Amazon’s Fire TV devices. It’s also adding flight control support to its streaming service.

articles.title: Intel launches Core Ultra Series 3 CPUs, made using its long-awaited 18A process - Ars Technica
articles.description: New chips launch "this month," targeting high-end ultraportable PCs.

articles.title: Baby's got clack: HP pushes PC-in-a-keyboard for businesses with hot desks - theregister.com
articles.description: : Notebook updates and enterprise tools also inbound from IT giant

articles.title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES - TechCrunch
articles.description: AMD announced the latest version of its AI-powered PC chips designed for a variety of tasks from gaming to content creation and multitasking.

articles.title: AMD’s new Ryzen 7 9850X3D makes the best gaming CPU even faster - The Verge
articles.description: AMD is launching an improved version of its 9800X3D processor. The new Ryzen 7 9850X3D has a better boost clock to offer improved frame rates in certain games.

articles.title: Yes, the Google app icon is now bigger on Android - 9to5Google
articles.description: The year in Google updates is well underway today with beta version 17.0 of the Google app on Android increasing the size of the app icon.
